body:
$!You must tell DVLA about your depression if it affects your driving.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

If you're not sure if your depression affects your driving, check with your doctor. 

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form. 

$D
[Download 'M1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 252KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066650.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

If you're not sure if your depression affects your driving, check with your doctor. 

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form. 

$D
[Download M1V 'Confidential medical information' (PDF, 243KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_172725.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA about your depression if it affects your driving - download the correct form to let them know
title: Depression and driving
